phylofisher.utilities.missing_data module¶

phylofisher.utilities.missing_data.completeness()¶

Comptutes completeness of genes based on either all taxa or a set of taxa provided by user

phylofisher.utilities.missing_data.genes_to_keep(df)¶
phylofisher.utilities.missing_data.make_gene_plot(df, plot_name, taxa_count)¶
Creates a plot of gene completeness. Plot is a bar chart with genes sorted from highest to lowest completeness on

the x-axis and percent complete on the y-axis. Completeness is calculated as percent of taxa the gene is present in.

Input: Pandas DataFrame, plot name Output: PDF of plot

phylofisher.utilities.missing_data.parse_aligns()¶

Parses all fasta files (w/ given suffix if provided) in the user-given input directory Input: NONE Output: dictionary with genes a keys and SeqIO iterator as values

phylofisher.utilities.missing_data.parse_metadata()¶

Parses metadata.csv to get all org names in each group and subtax Input: NONE Output: (1) dictionary with groups/subtax as keys and sets of orgs in those groups/subtax as values

  1. list of all orgs in metadata

phylofisher.utilities.missing_data.parse_taxa_list()¶

Parses user-input taxa list Input: NONE Ouput: List of user-input taxa

phylofisher.utilities.missing_data.subsetter(df)¶

phylofisher.utilities.random_sample_iteration module¶

phylofisher.utilities.random_sample_iteration.clean_up()¶

Copies matricies in to root output directory and tar’s “percent” directories

phylofisher.utilities.random_sample_iteration.get_num_of_replicates(x)¶

Uses 0.95=1-(1-x/100)^n to determine the number of replicates where x is the percentage of genes samples and n is the number of replicates

phylofisher.utilities.random_sample_iteration.make_csv()¶
phylofisher.utilities.random_sample_iteration.make_tmp_dir(base)¶

Makes tmpo directory. If it exists the old tmp directory is first removed

phylofisher.utilities.random_sample_iteration.subsample(percent, genes, output)¶

Creates gene subsets and super matirices of the subsampled gene sets.
